verses.roman:
dugdha āuṭi' dadhi mathe tomāra gopī-gaṇe
āmāra ṭhākurāṇī vaise ratna-siṁhāsane

synonyms: dugdha āuṭi'-boiling milk; dadhi—into yogurt; mathe—churn; tomāra—your; gopī-gaṇe—gopīs; āmāra—my; ṭhākurāṇī—mistress; vaise—sits down; ratna-siṁhāsane—on a throne of gems.
translation: Śrīvāsa Ṭhākura continued to address Svarūpa Dāmodara: "Your gopīs are engaged in boiling milk and churning it to turn it into yogurt, but my mistress, the goddess of fortune, sits on a throne made of jewels and gems."
